member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FAPPOBJECT
member.summary: A type description that describes an Application object.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FCANCREATE
member.summary: Instances of the type can be created by ITypeInfo.CreateInstance.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FPREDECLID
member.summary: The type is predefined. The client application should automatically create a single instance of the object that has this attribute. The name of the variable that points to the object is the same as the class name of the object.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FHIDDEN
member.summary: The type should not be displayed to browsers.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FCONTROL
member.summary: The type is a control from which other types will be derived, and should not be displayed to users.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FDUAL
member.summary: The interface supplies both IDispatch and VTBL binding.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FNONEXTENSIBLE
member.summary: The interface cannot add members at run time.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FOLEAUTOMATION
member.summary: The types used in the interface are fully compatible with Automation, including VTBL binding support. Setting dual on an interface sets this flag in addition to TYPEFLAG_FDUAL. Not allowed on dispinterfaces.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FRESTRICTED
member.summary: Should not be accessible from macro languages. This flag is intended for system-level types or types that type browsers should not display.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FDISPATCHABLE
member.summary: Indicates that the interface derives from IDispatch, either directly or indirectly. This flag is computed. There is no Object Description Language for the flag.

member.name: TYPEFLAGS.TYPEFLAG_FPROXY
member.summary: Interfaces can be marked with this flag to indicate that they will be using a proxy/stub dynamic link library. This flag specifies that the typelib proxy should not be unregistered when the typelib is unregistered.
